subject: Technology
title: How Self-Driving Cars See the Road
description: A micro-lesson that makes How Self-Driving Cars See the Road usable.

hook.text: A self-driving car must process more visual information in one second than a human processes in an hour.

buildup.text: Autonomous vehicles combine cameras, radar, lidar, and ultrasonic sensors to build a 3D map of their surroundings.

discovery.text: Lidar shoots millions of laser pulses per second, creating a point cloud that reveals every object nearby.

twist.text: Tesla controversially relies only on cameras, claiming lidar is unnecessary. Most competitors disagree strongly.

climax.text: The real challenge isn't seeing the road. It's understanding what unpredictable humans will do on it.

punchline.text: Self-driving cars can see everything. Predicting humans is the hard part.

quiz.question: What is the main challenge for self-driving cars?
